trans-unit.source: Welcome message to the TYPO3 backend.
trans-unit.target: Welcome message to the TYPO3 backend.

trans-unit.source:
Welcome to the TYPO3 CMS!

This is the backend of TYPO3 CMS. Here you can manage your content, users, and settings.

By navigating through the different modules, you will be present with a series of interactive tours that will guide you through the most important features and functionalities of TYPO3 CMS. We encourage you to take the time to explore these tours, as they will help you get familiar with the system and make the most out of it.

Enjoy your time with TYPO3 CMS!
trans-unit.target:
Welcome to the TYPO3 CMS!

This is the backend of TYPO3 CMS. Here you can manage your content, users, and settings.

By navigating through the different modules, you will be present with a series of interactive tours that will guide you through the most important features and functionalities of TYPO3 CMS. We encourage you to take the time to explore these tours, as they will help you get familiar with the system and make the most out of it.

Enjoy your time with TYPO3 CMS!

trans-unit.source: This tour will guide you through the backend of TYPO3 CMS.
trans-unit.target: This tour will guide you through the backend of TYPO3 CMS.

trans-unit.source: This is the backend of TYPO3. Here you can manage your content, users, and settings. In this tour, we will explore the main backend parts.
trans-unit.target: This is the backend of TYPO3. Here you can manage your content, users, and settings. In this tour, we will explore the main backend parts.

trans-unit.source: This is Top Bar. It gives you access to your user settings, logout, search etc.
trans-unit.target: This is Top Bar. It gives you access to your user settings, logout, search etc.

trans-unit.source:
By clicking on this button, you will access your account menu.

From here you can:

  • Open your user settings
  • Toggle dark/ light mode
  • Logout from the backend
trans-unit.target:
By clicking on this button, you will access your account menu.

From here you can:

  • Open your user settings
  • Toggle dark/ light mode
  • Logout from the backend

trans-unit.source:
The main menu is located on the left side of the screen. Here you can navigate through the backend.

Main Menu contains links to modules that are grouped by functionality. You can expand and collapse each group by clicking on the group name.

Active module is always highlighted with a light background and tiny border around it.
trans-unit.target:
The main menu is located on the left side of the screen. Here you can navigate through the backend.

Main Menu contains links to modules that are grouped by functionality. You can expand and collapse each group by clicking on the group name.

Active module is always highlighted with a light background and tiny border around it.

trans-unit.source: By clicking this button, you can toggle the main menu to display either icons only or icons with module names.
trans-unit.target: By clicking this button, you can toggle the main menu to display either icons only or icons with module names.

trans-unit.source: As you now know, TYPO3 is build up of modules. Each module has its own views and offers different functionality. In this area you will see the selected module content.
trans-unit.target: As you now know, TYPO3 is build up of modules. Each module has its own views and offers different functionality. In this area you will see the selected module content.

trans-unit.source: You have completed the introduction to TYPO3 backend. Check out the next tours to learn more about different parts of the TYPO3 backend.
trans-unit.target: You have completed the introduction to TYPO3 backend. Check out the next tours to learn more about different parts of the TYPO3 backend.

trans-unit.source: Learn about the role of the Dashboard module and how to manage widgets.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the role of the Dashboard module and how to manage widgets.

trans-unit.source:
You are now in the Dashboard module. It is the very first module in the main menu.

The Dashboard module is a central place where you can build your own dashboards and arrange widgets to suit your needs.
trans-unit.target:
You are now in the Dashboard module. It is the very first module in the main menu.

The Dashboard module is a central place where you can build your own dashboards and arrange widgets to suit your needs.

trans-unit.source:
You will see a list of available dashboards as a tabs at the top of the module.

Each dashboard is a collection of widgets that can be arranged and customized to suit your needs.
trans-unit.target:
You will see a list of available dashboards as a tabs at the top of the module.

Each dashboard is a collection of widgets that can be arranged and customized to suit your needs.

trans-unit.source: You can create a new dashboard by clicking on this button.
trans-unit.target: You can create a new dashboard by clicking on this button.

trans-unit.source:
After clicking on the Add dashboard button, a dialog will appear, allowing you to enter the name of your new dashboard.

You can also choose between creating an empty dashboard or selecting a predefined dashboard (with relevant widgets already included).
trans-unit.target:
After clicking on the Add dashboard button, a dialog will appear, allowing you to enter the name of your new dashboard.

You can also choose between creating an empty dashboard or selecting a predefined dashboard (with relevant widgets already included).

trans-unit.source: You can edit the name of your dashboard by clicking on this button.
trans-unit.target: You can edit the name of your dashboard by clicking on this button.

trans-unit.source:
It will open a dialog where you can change the name of your dashboard.

Just enter the new name and click on the Save button.
trans-unit.target:
It will open a dialog where you can change the name of your dashboard.

Just enter the new name and click on the Save button.

trans-unit.source: You can delete existing dashboard by clicking on this button.
trans-unit.target: You can delete existing dashboard by clicking on this button.

trans-unit.source: To add widgets to your dashboard, click on the Add widget button.
trans-unit.target: To add widgets to your dashboard, click on the Add widget button.

trans-unit.source:
A dialog will appear, allowing you to select the widgets you want to add to your dashboard.

Widgets are grouped by category, making it easier to find the one you're looking for.

You can also filter widgets by typing into the search field.
trans-unit.target:
A dialog will appear, allowing you to select the widgets you want to add to your dashboard.

Widgets are grouped by category, making it easier to find the one you're looking for.

You can also filter widgets by typing into the search field.

trans-unit.source:
You can arrange the widgets on your dashboard by dragging and dropping them to the desired position.

Widgets can have different sizes, so you can create a layout that suits your needs.

Just play around with the widgets and see what they offer. Enjoy!
trans-unit.target:
You can arrange the widgets on your dashboard by dragging and dropping them to the desired position.

Widgets can have different sizes, so you can create a layout that suits your needs.

Just play around with the widgets and see what they offer. Enjoy!

trans-unit.source: This tour will guide you through the Pages module of TYPO3 CMS.
trans-unit.target: This tour will guide you through the Pages module of TYPO3 CMS.

trans-unit.source:
You are now in the Page module. Here you can view and manage your website’s pages and content.

If you navigate to another module, you can always return to the Page module by selecting this entry in the main menu.
trans-unit.target:
You are now in the Page module. Here you can view and manage your website’s pages and content.

If you navigate to another module, you can always return to the Page module by selecting this entry in the main menu.

trans-unit.source:
Page management is handled through the Page Tree component.

From this area, you can create new pages, edit existing ones, manage their properties, rearrange their order, and more.
trans-unit.target:
Page management is handled through the Page Tree component.

From this area, you can create new pages, edit existing ones, manage their properties, rearrange their order, and more.

trans-unit.source:
You can filter pages using the search field.

Simply type the name of the page you’re looking for, and the tree will display only the pages that match your search term.
trans-unit.target:
You can filter pages using the search field.

Simply type the name of the page you’re looking for, and the tree will display only the pages that match your search term.

trans-unit.source: This button toggles the page tree’s visibility - allowing it to be hidden or shown.
trans-unit.target: This button toggles the page tree’s visibility - allowing it to be hidden or shown.

trans-unit.source: New pages of various types can be created by dragging the desired page type icon from the Page Type Inspector into the Page Tree.
trans-unit.target: New pages of various types can be created by dragging the desired page type icon from the Page Type Inspector into the Page Tree.

trans-unit.source:
This button allows you to open the context menu for the page tree, revealing a list of actions you can perform.

Click "Next" to learn more about the context menu.
trans-unit.target:
This button allows you to open the context menu for the page tree, revealing a list of actions you can perform.

Click "Next" to learn more about the context menu.

trans-unit.source:
From here, you can:

  • Reload the entire tree to view the latest changes (useful when multiple users are working on it)
  • Collapse all tree items (especially helpful for navigating large trees)
trans-unit.target:
From here, you can:

  • Reload the entire tree to view the latest changes (useful when multiple users are working on it)
  • Collapse all tree items (especially helpful for navigating large trees)

trans-unit.source:
To proceed to the next step, please click 👆 on the homepage name or the first page you have access to.
If you don't have any pages yet, you can create one by dragging and dropping the page icon from the page type inspector (above the page tree) into the page tree.

Later, you can also create a new page by clicking on a page icon in the page tree to open the context menu and selecting "New subpage".
trans-unit.target:
To proceed to the next step, please click 👆 on the homepage name or the first page you have access to.
If you don't have any pages yet, you can create one by dragging and dropping the page icon from the page type inspector (above the page tree) into the page tree.

Later, you can also create a new page by clicking on a page icon in the page tree to open the context menu and selecting "New subpage".

trans-unit.source:
In this area, you can manage the content of the selected page.

You can:

  • Edit individual content elements
  • Add new content elements
  • Change the order of content elements
  • Preview the page
  • Edit page properties
...and more.
trans-unit.target:
In this area, you can manage the content of the selected page.

You can:

  • Edit individual content elements
  • Add new content elements
  • Change the order of content elements
  • Preview the page
  • Edit page properties
...and more.

trans-unit.source:
You can create new content elements by clicking on the Create new content button.

You can see multiple buttons like this one, depending on the page layout and how many content elements are already present.

They allow you to create new content elements in different areas and positions on the page.
trans-unit.target:
You can create new content elements by clicking on the Create new content button.

You can see multiple buttons like this one, depending on the page layout and how many content elements are already present.

They allow you to create new content elements in different areas and positions on the page.

trans-unit.source:
Content elements are grouped by category, making it easier to find the one you're looking for.

You can also filter content elements by typing into the search field.

To add a new content element, simply click on the desired content element type.

A new form will open, allowing you to enter the details of the new content element.

When you finish, click on the Save button to save the changes.
trans-unit.target:
Content elements are grouped by category, making it easier to find the one you're looking for.

You can also filter content elements by typing into the search field.

To add a new content element, simply click on the desired content element type.

A new form will open, allowing you to enter the details of the new content element.

When you finish, click on the Save button to save the changes.

trans-unit.source: You can quickly edit the page title by double-clicking the title or by clicking the edit icon.
trans-unit.target: You can quickly edit the page title by double-clicking the title or by clicking the edit icon.

trans-unit.source: You can preview the page and its content at any time, by clicking on the View webpage button.
trans-unit.target: You can preview the page and its content at any time, by clicking on the View webpage button.

trans-unit.source: You can edit current page properties, by clicking on the Edit page properties button.
trans-unit.target: You can edit current page properties, by clicking on the Edit page properties button.

trans-unit.source:
Most of the modules offer a toolbar in the top right corner.

Depending on your permissions, you will have access to:

  • Refresh button
  • View menu
  • Share menu (create bookmark / copy URL)
trans-unit.target:
Most of the modules offer a toolbar in the top right corner.

Depending on your permissions, you will have access to:

  • Refresh button
  • View menu
  • Share menu (create bookmark / copy URL)

trans-unit.source: Find out what previewing a page in the backend looks like.
trans-unit.target: Find out what previewing a page in the backend looks like.

trans-unit.source: You are now in the View module. It allows to preview the current page for different screen sizes, screen orientations and more.
trans-unit.target: You are now in the View module. It allows to preview the current page for different screen sizes, screen orientations and more.

trans-unit.source:
Select the page you want to preview (by clicking 👆 on its name).
If there are no pages yet, you can create one by dragging and dropping the page icon from the page type inspector (above the page tree) into the page tree.

Previews are available only for standard pages (not folders or other page types).
trans-unit.target:
Select the page you want to preview (by clicking 👆 on its name).
If there are no pages yet, you can create one by dragging and dropping the page icon from the page type inspector (above the page tree) into the page tree.

Previews are available only for standard pages (not folders or other page types).

trans-unit.source: When you select a page, the preview box will show at the center of to content area.
trans-unit.target: When you select a page, the preview box will show at the center of to content area.

trans-unit.source: By clicking on this icon, You can change the orientation of the preview.
trans-unit.target: By clicking on this icon, You can change the orientation of the preview.

trans-unit.source: By clicking on the sizes presets menu, you can select the screen size you want to preview or define a custom size.
trans-unit.target: By clicking on the sizes presets menu, you can select the screen size you want to preview or define a custom size.

trans-unit.source: The list of available sizes presets depends on the configuration of your TYPO3 installation.
trans-unit.target: The list of available sizes presets depends on the configuration of your TYPO3 installation.

trans-unit.source: You can also open the current page preview in a new tab by clicking on this button.
trans-unit.target: You can also open the current page preview in a new tab by clicking on this button.

trans-unit.source: Play around with the preview and see how it looks on different devices. Enjoy!
trans-unit.target: Play around with the preview and see how it looks on different devices. Enjoy!

trans-unit.source: This tour will guide you through the backend of TYPO3 CMS.
trans-unit.target: This tour will guide you through the backend of TYPO3 CMS.

trans-unit.source: You are now in the List module. It will allow you to view and manage records of a specific tables.
trans-unit.target: You are now in the List module. It will allow you to view and manage records of a specific tables.

trans-unit.source:
Different type of records, listed by this module, are stored on different pages.

You can navigate through the pages using the Page Tree component, to see the records stored on each page.

👆 Now, please click on the homepage title, to move to the next step.
trans-unit.target:
Different type of records, listed by this module, are stored on different pages.

You can navigate through the pages using the Page Tree component, to see the records stored on each page.

👆 Now, please click on the homepage title, to move to the next step.

trans-unit.source:
The list of records is displayed in the main content area.

Different types of records are shown in separate tables. Clicking on a table header will take you directly to the single-table view.

Each table also provides various actions, such as creating new records, deleting records, or editing existing ones.

Note that you will only see records assigned to the page currently selected in the page tree.
trans-unit.target:
The list of records is displayed in the main content area.

Different types of records are shown in separate tables. Clicking on a table header will take you directly to the single-table view.

Each table also provides various actions, such as creating new records, deleting records, or editing existing ones.

Note that you will only see records assigned to the page currently selected in the page tree.

trans-unit.source:
To create a new record, click on the "Create new record" button.

You will see a list of all available record types. You can select one to create a new record on the current page.
trans-unit.target:
To create a new record, click on the "Create new record" button.

You will see a list of all available record types. You can select one to create a new record on the current page.

trans-unit.source: By clicking on the View webpage button, you can preview the page in a new tab.
trans-unit.target: By clicking on the View webpage button, you can preview the page in a new tab.

trans-unit.source: By clicking on the Edit page properties button, you can edit the properties of the current page.
trans-unit.target: By clicking on the Edit page properties button, you can edit the properties of the current page.

trans-unit.source: To refresh the list of records, click on the Refresh button.
trans-unit.target: To refresh the list of records, click on the Refresh button.

trans-unit.source: By clicking on the View button, you can toggle the view options.
trans-unit.target: By clicking on the View button, you can toggle the view options.

trans-unit.source: The view dropdown menu allows you to show the search field and the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: The view dropdown menu allows you to show the search field and the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: This tour will guide you through the Files module of TYPO3 CMS.
trans-unit.target: This tour will guide you through the Files module of TYPO3 CMS.

trans-unit.source: Files module is a powerful tool that allows you to manage files and folders in TYPO3.
trans-unit.target: Files module is a powerful tool that allows you to manage files and folders in TYPO3.

trans-unit.source:
The Files Storage Tree is located on the left side of the screen.

It renders a tree view of all available file storages and folders.
trans-unit.target:
The Files Storage Tree is located on the left side of the screen.

It renders a tree view of all available file storages and folders.

trans-unit.source: You can search for folders by typing into the search field.
trans-unit.target: You can search for folders by typing into the search field.

trans-unit.source: This button toggles the storage tree’s visibility - allowing it to be hidden or shown.
trans-unit.target: This button toggles the storage tree’s visibility - allowing it to be hidden or shown.

trans-unit.source:
This button allows you to open the context menu for the storage tree, revealing a list of actions you can perform.

Click "Next" to learn more about the context menu.
trans-unit.target:
This button allows you to open the context menu for the storage tree, revealing a list of actions you can perform.

Click "Next" to learn more about the context menu.

trans-unit.source:
From here, you can:

  • Reload the entire tree to view the latest changes (useful when multiple users are working on it)
  • Collapse all tree items (especially helpful for navigating large trees)
trans-unit.target:
From here, you can:

  • Reload the entire tree to view the latest changes (useful when multiple users are working on it)
  • Collapse all tree items (especially helpful for navigating large trees)

trans-unit.source: The Upload Files button allows you to upload files to the selected folder.
trans-unit.target: The Upload Files button allows you to upload files to the selected folder.

trans-unit.source: The Create Folder button allows you to create a new folder in the current directory.
trans-unit.target: The Create Folder button allows you to create a new folder in the current directory.

trans-unit.source: The Create File button opens form to create a new file text or media files.
trans-unit.target: The Create File button opens form to create a new file text or media files.

trans-unit.source: You can search for files and folders using the search field.
trans-unit.target: You can search for files and folders using the search field.

trans-unit.source:
All files and folders in this area.

Click on a folder to open it and view its contents.

Click on a file name to open a form where you can edit its metadata.
trans-unit.target:
All files and folders in this area.

Click on a folder to open it and view its contents.

Click on a file name to open a form where you can edit its metadata.

trans-unit.source: You can refresh the file list to see any changes made.
trans-unit.target: You can refresh the file list to see any changes made.

trans-unit.source: View Menu allows you to change the various display options for the file list.
trans-unit.target: View Menu allows you to change the various display options for the file list.

trans-unit.source:
You can change the view from tiles to list and vice versa.

You can also activate thumbnail display and show the clipboard.

Clipboard is a temporary storage area where you can place files and folders for copying or moving.
trans-unit.target:
You can change the view from tiles to list and vice versa.

You can also activate thumbnail display and show the clipboard.

Clipboard is a temporary storage area where you can place files and folders for copying or moving.

trans-unit.source:
Try to organize your files in a way that makes sense to you.

Use folders to group related files together.
trans-unit.target:
Try to organize your files in a way that makes sense to you.

Use folders to group related files together.

trans-unit.source: Get familiar with the Site Redirects module and learn how to create and manage redirects for your website.
trans-unit.target: Get familiar with the Site Redirects module and learn how to create and manage redirects for your website.

trans-unit.source:
Site redirects are a powerful feature that allows you to manage and create redirects for your website.

You can create redirects for specific pages, URLs, or even entire domains.
trans-unit.target:
Site redirects are a powerful feature that allows you to manage and create redirects for your website.

You can create redirects for specific pages, URLs, or even entire domains.

trans-unit.source:
In the main module area you will see a list of all existing redirects.

If there are no redirects yet, you will see a message indicating that there are no redirects and a button to create a new one.

You can filter the list of redirects by using the filter form at the top of the module.

The tabele with the redirects will allow you to:
  • Edit the redirect
  • Disable the redirect
  • Delete the redirect
trans-unit.target:
In the main module area you will see a list of all existing redirects.

If there are no redirects yet, you will see a message indicating that there are no redirects and a button to create a new one.

You can filter the list of redirects by using the filter form at the top of the module.

The tabele with the redirects will allow you to:
  • Edit the redirect
  • Disable the redirect
  • Delete the redirect

trans-unit.source: You can refresh the list at any time, by clicking on this button.
trans-unit.target: You can refresh the list at any time, by clicking on this button.

trans-unit.source:
You can create a new redirect by clicking on the Add redirect button.

it will open a new form, where you can enter the details of the redirect.
trans-unit.target:
You can create a new redirect by clicking on the Add redirect button.

it will open a new form, where you can enter the details of the redirect.

trans-unit.source:
Use redirects to manage changes to your website's URLs, such as:

  • Moving pages to new locations
  • Changing the structure of your website
Redirects ensure that visitors and search engines can find the content they’re looking for, even if the URL has changed.
trans-unit.target:
Use redirects to manage changes to your website's URLs, such as:

  • Moving pages to new locations
  • Changing the structure of your website
Redirects ensure that visitors and search engines can find the content they’re looking for, even if the URL has changed.
